data.title: The Bunge Oil Mill
data.meta_description: Between 1920 and 1990, the company with currently approx. 200 employees belonged to Unilever, afterwards to the Cereol group, and since 2003 to the Bunge Group, one of the world’s largest trading and processing companies of oil and grain seeds.
data.text:
Location Mannheim

The oil mill in Mannheim was founded in 1887 as a merger of 9 small Southern German oil mills and is still known under the name VDO (Association of German oil factories). It is one of the world's largest oil mills – 1.1 to 1.2 million tons of oilseeds are processed annually in order to produce vegetable oils and rape meal.

Bunge Deutschland GmbH
